meanings.sent1: The leaden statue stood in the park.
meanings.sent2: The artist crafted a leaden figurine.
meanings.sent3: The leaden toy soldier seemed too heavy to march.
meanings.sent4: Her leaden footsteps echoed in the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The leaden sky threatened rain all day.

meanings.definition: Dull or heavy in movement or expression.
meanings.sent1: His leaden eyes showed no excitement.
meanings.sent2: The meeting ended with a leaden silence.
meanings.sent3: The leaden dance performance lacked energy.
meanings.sent4: Her leaden response dampened the mood.
meanings.sent5: The leaden pace of the turtle race amused the spectators.

meanings.sent1: The leaden heat made everyone drowsy.
meanings.sent2: The leaden traffic delayed their arrival.
meanings.sent3: The leaden atmosphere in the room stifled conversation.
meanings.sent4: His leaden thoughts weighed on his mind.
meanings.sent5: The leaden progress of the snail was comical to watch.
